Articles.Content: What if you could run simple procedures for action groups (instead of doing everything at once)?

It depends on how many actions are being used. If there's less than 10, then you can set up multiple action groups to accomplish the specific procedure you want.

If there's more than that, then there's no reason why you can't group similar actions to an action group, such as first deploying all solar panels, then antennae, and then ladders or whatever else.

How much are you trying to accomplish?

Action Groups Extended allows up to 256(?) groups for various actions combinations.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/74195-0-90-%28Jan31-15%29-Action-Groups-Extended-250-Action-Groups-in-flight-editing-Now-kOS-Support!

What if you could run simple procedures for action groups (instead of doing everything at once)?

when you say programming do you mean like *PRESS AG 5*=open cargo doors>wait 5 seconds>extend solar panels.

like short(or long) scripts of actions in order with time delays between.

If that is what you mean, then I'm all for it!
I believe Kos Has the ability to activate action groups,, so you could use that
